member.name: T:B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest
member.summary: Represents a single request to be sent in a batch to the Service Layer.

member.name: P:B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest.HttpMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP method to be used for this request.

member.name: P:B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest.Resource
member.summary: Gets or sets the Service Layer resource to be requested.

member.name: P:B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the JSON body to be sent. It can be either an object to be serialized as JSON or a JSON string.

member.name: P:B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest.ContentID
member.summary: Gets or sets the Content-ID for this request, an entity reference that can be used by subsequent requests to refer to a new entity created within the same change set. This is optional for OData Version 3 (b1s/v1) but mandatory for OData Version 4 (b1s/v2).

member.name: P:B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest.Encoding
member.summary: Gets or sets the to be used for this request. UTF8 will be used by default.

member.name: P:B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest.JsonSerializerOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the to be used for this request. By default it is configured so the is set to .

member.name: P:B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest.HttpVersion
member.summary: Gets or sets the HTTP message version to be used for this request. Version 1.1 will be used by default.

member.name: P:B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest.Headers
member.summary: The HTTP headers to be sent in this request.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, which represents the details of a request to be sent in a batch.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest.#ctor(System.Net.Http.HttpMethod,System.String,System.Object,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, which represents the details of a request to be sent in a batch.
member.param: The HTTP method to be used for this request.
The Service Layer resource to be requested.
The JSON body to be sent. It can be either an object to be serialized as JSON or a JSON string.

Entity reference that can be used by subsequent requests to refer to a new entity created within the same change set. This is optional for OData Version 3 (b1s/v1) but mandatory for OData Version 4 (b1s/v2).

member.summary: Enables a case-insensitive query.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLBatchRequestExtensions.WithReplaceCollectionsOnPatch(B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest)
member.summary: Allows a PATCH request to remove items in a collection.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLBatchRequestExtensions.WithReturnNoContent(B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest)
member.summary: Configures a POST request to not return the created entity. This is suitable for better performance in demanding scenarios where the return content is not needed.
member.remarks: On success, is returned, instead of .

member.summary: Adds a custom request header to be sent.

member.name: P:B1SLayer.SLConnection.Language
member.summary: Gets the Service Layer language code provided.

member.summary: Gets or sets the number of attempts for each unsuccessful request in case of an HTTP status code contained in .

member.summary: Gets or sets the timespan to wait before a batch request times out. The default value is 5 minutes (300 seconds).

member.summary: Gets whether this instance is using Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication.

member.summary: Gets information about the latest Login request.

member.name: P:B1SLayer.SLConnection.HttpStatusCodesToRetry
member.summary: Gets a list of to be checked before retrying an unsuccessful request.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.#ctor(System.Uri,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Only one instance per company/user should be used in the application.
member.param: The Service Layer root URI. The expected format is https://[server]:[port]/b1s/[version]
The Company database (schema) to connect to.
The SAP user to be used for the Service Layer authentication.
The password for the provided user.

The language code to be used. Specify a code if you want error messages in some specific language other than English. A GET request to the UserLanguages resource will return all available languages and their respective codes.

The number of attempts for each request in case of an HTTP response code of 401, 500, 502, 503 or 504. If the response code is 401 (Unauthorized), a login request will be performed before the new attempt.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32},System.Int32)

member.param: The Service Layer root URI. The expected format is https://[server]:[port]/b1s/[version]
The Company database (schema) to connect to.
The SAP user to be used for the Service Layer authentication.
The password for the provided user.

The language code to be used. Specify a code if you want error messages in some specific language other than English. A GET request to the UserLanguages resource will return all available languages and their respective codes.

The number of attempts for each request in case of an HTTP response code of 401, 500, 502, 503 or 504. If the response code is 401 (Unauthorized), a login request will be performed before the new attempt.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Only one instance per company/user should be used in the application.
member.param: The Service Layer root URI. The expected format is https://[server]:[port]/b1s/[version]
The Company database (schema) to connect to.
The SAP user to be used for the Service Layer authentication.
The password for the provided user.

The language code to be used. Specify a code if you want error messages in some specific language other than English. A GET request to the UserLanguages resource will return all available languages and their respective codes.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.#ctor(System.Uri,System.Func{System.String,System.String},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication.
member.param: The Service Layer root URI. The expected format is https://[server]:[port]/b1s/[version]
The reference for the UI API method responsible for obtaining the connection context (SAPbouiCOM.Framework.Application.SBO_Application.Company.GetServiceLayerConnectionContext).

The timeout value in minutes for a Service Layer session. If the configured value differs from the default 30 minutes, specify it through this parameter. Check the "SessionTimeout" property in the file "b1s.conf" on the server.

The number of attempts for each request in case of an HTTP response code of 401, 500, 502, 503 or 504. If the response code is 401 (Unauthorized), a login request will be performed before the new attempt.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.#ctor(System.String,System.Func{System.String,System.String},System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using Single Sign-On (SSO) authentication.
member.param: The Service Layer root URI. The expected format is https://[server]:[port]/b1s/[version]
The reference for the UI API method responsible for obtaining the connection context (SAPbouiCOM.Framework.Application.SBO_Application.Company.GetServiceLayerConnectionContext).

The timeout value in minutes for a Service Layer session. If the configured value differs from the default 30 minutes, specify it through this parameter. Check the "SessionTimeout" property in the file "b1s.conf" on the server.

The number of attempts for each request in case of an HTTP response code of 401, 500, 502, 503 or 504. If the response code is 401 (Unauthorized), a login request will be performed before the new attempt.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.LoginAsync
member.summary: Performs a POST Login request with the provided information, regardless of the current session state.
member.remarks: Manually performing the Login is often unnecessary because it will be performed automatically anyway whenever needed.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.ExecuteLoginAsync(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Performs the POST Login request to the Service Layer.
member.param: Whether the login information should be returned.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.GetSessionCookiesAsync
member.summary: Obtains the current session cookies from the distribued cache. A login is performed if no valid cookies are retrieved from cache.
member.returns: The current session cookies to be used in each request.

member.summary: Sets the given session cookies to the distributed cache.
member.param: The cookies to be set to the distributed cache.
The sliding expiration time for the session cache.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.InvalidateSessionCacheAsync
member.summary: Removes the current active session from the distributed cache.

member.summary: Creates a instance from the context string obtained from the UI API method "GetServiceLayerConnectionContext";
member.param: The connection context string obtained from UI API.
member.returns: A instance containing session cookies obtained after a successful authentication.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.LogoutAsync

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.ExecuteRequest``1(System.Func{System.Threading.Tasks.Task{``0}})
member.summary: Calls the Login method to ensure a valid session and then executes the provided request. If the request is unsuccessfull with any return code present in , it will be retried for number of times.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.PingAsync
member.summary: Provides a direct response from the Apache server that can be used for network testing and component monitoring. In response to a PING request, the Apache server (load balancer or node) will respond directly with a simple PONG response.
member.remarks: This feature is only available on version 9.3 PL10 or above. See SAP Note 2796799 for more details.
member.returns: A object containing the response details.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.PingNodeAsync(System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Provides a direct response from the Apache server that can be used for network testing and component monitoring. In response to a PING request, the Apache server (load balancer or node) will respond directly with a simple PONG response.
member.remarks: This feature is only available on version 9.3 PL10 or above. See SAP Note 2796799 for more details.
member.param: The specific node to be monitored. If not specified, the request will be directed to the load balancer.
member.returns: A object containing the response details.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.ExecutePingAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Performs the ping request with the provided path segment.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.BeforeCall(System.Func{Flurl.Http.FlurlCall,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Sets a delegate that is called before every Service Layer request.
member.remarks: The object provides various details about the call than can be used for logging and error handling. Response-related properties will be null in BeforeCall.

member.summary: Sets a delegate that is called before every Service Layer request.
member.remarks: The object provides various details about the call than can be used for logging and error handling. Response-related properties will be null in BeforeCall.

member.summary: Sets a delegate that is called after every Service Layer request.
member.remarks: The object provides various details about the call than can be used for logging and error handling.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.OnError(System.Func{Flurl.Http.FlurlCall,System.Threading.Tasks.Task})
member.summary: Sets a delegate that is called after every unsuccessful Service Layer request.
member.remarks: The object provides various details about the call than can be used for logging and error handling.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.OnError(System.Action{Flurl.Http.FlurlCall})
member.summary: Sets a delegate that is called after every unsuccessful Service Layer request.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.PostAttachmentAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Uploads the provided file as an attachment.
member.remarks: An attachment folder must be defined. See section 'Setting up an Attachment Folder' in the Service Layer User Manual for more details.
member.param: The path to the file to be uploaded.
member.returns: A object with information about the created attachment entry.

member.param: The file name of the file to be uploaded including the file extension.
The file to be uploaded.
member.returns: A object with information about the created attachment entry.

member.summary: Uploads the provided file as an attachment.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.PostAttachmentsAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Byte[]})
member.summary: Uploads the provided files as an attachment. All files will be posted as attachment lines in a single attachment entry.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.PatchAttachmentAsync(System.Int32,System.String)

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.GetAttachmentAsStreamAsync(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Downloads the specified attachment file as a . By default, the first attachment line is downloaded if there are multiple attachment lines in one attachment.
member.param: The attachment entry ID to be downloaded.
The file name of the attachment to be downloaded (including the file extension). Only required if you want to download an attachment line other than the first attachment line.
member.returns: The downloaded attachment file as a .

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.GetAttachmentAsBytesAsync(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Downloads the specified attachment file as a array. By default, the first attachment line is downloaded if there are multiple attachment lines in one attachment.
member.param: The attachment entry ID to be downloaded.
The file name of the attachment to be downloaded (including the file extension). Only required if you want to download an attachment line other than the first attachment line.
member.returns: The downloaded attachment file as a array.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.PostBatchAsync(B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest[])
member.summary: Sends a batch request (multiple operations sent in a single HTTP request) with the provided instances. All requests are sent in a single change set.
member.remarks: See section 'Batch Operations' in the Service Layer User Manual for more details.
member.param: instances to be sent in the batch.
member.returns: An array containg the response messages of the batch request.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLConnection.PostBatchAsync(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{B1SLayer.SLBatchRequest},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a batch request (multiple operations sent in a single HTTP request) with the provided collection.
member.remarks: See section 'Batch Operations' in the Service Layer User Manual for more details.
member.param: A collection of to be sent in the batch.
Whether all the requests in this batch should be sent in a single change set. This means that any unsuccessful request will cause the whole batch to be rolled back.
member.returns: An array containg the response messages of the batch request.

member.name: T:B1SLayer.SLConnection.ExceptionEqualityComparer
member.summary: Used to aggregate exceptions that occur on request retries.
member.remarks: In most cases, the same exception will occur multiple times, but we don't want to return multiple copies of it. This class is used to find exceptions that are duplicates by type and message so we can only return one of them.

member.summary: Represents a Service Layer exception.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequest.GetAllAsync``1
member.summary: Performs multiple GET requests until all entities in a collection are obtained. The result will always be unwrapped from the 'value' array.
member.remarks: This can be very slow depending on the total amount of entities in the company database.
member.typeparam: The object type for the result to be deserialized into.
member.returns: An containing all the entities in the given collection.

member.name: T:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods definitions for .

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.Filter(B1SLayer.SLRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the clause to be used to filter records.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.Select(B1SLayer.SLRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the explicit properties that should be returned.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.OrderBy(B1SLayer.SLRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the order in which entities should be returned.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.Top(B1SLayer.SLRequest,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of first records to be included in the result.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.Skip(B1SLayer.SLRequest,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the number of first results to be excluded from the result.
member.remarks: Where $top and $skip are used together, the $skip is applied before the $top, regardless of the order of appearance in the request. This can be used when implementing a pagination mechanism.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.Apply(B1SLayer.SLRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the aggregation expression.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.Expand(B1SLayer.SLRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the navigation properties to be retrieved.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.SetQueryParam(B1SLayer.SLRequest,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Sets a custom query parameter to be sent.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.WithPageSize(B1SLayer.SLRequest,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the page size when paging is applied for a query. The default value is 20.
member.param: The current request.
The page size to be defined for this request.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.WithCaseInsensitive(B1SLayer.SLRequest)
member.summary: Enables a case-insensitive query.
member.remarks: This is only applicable to SAP HANA databases, where every query is case-sensitive by default.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.WithReplaceCollectionsOnPatch(B1SLayer.SLRequest)
member.summary: Allows a PATCH request to remove items in a collection.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.WithReturnNoContent(B1SLayer.SLRequest)
member.summary: Configures a POST request to not return the created entity. This is suitable for better performance in demanding scenarios where the return content is not needed.
member.remarks: On success, is returned, instead of .

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.WithHeader(B1SLayer.SLRequest,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a custom request header to be sent.
member.param: The current request.
The name of the header.
The value of the header.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.AllowHttpStatus(B1SLayer.SLRequest,System.Net.HttpStatusCode[])
member.summary: Configures the request to not throw an exception when the response has any of the provided .
member.remarks: By default, every reponse with an unsuccessful (non-2XX) will result in a throw.
member.param: The current request.
The to be allowed.

member.name: M:B1SLayer.SLRequestExtensions.AllowAnyHttpStatus(B1SLayer.SLRequest)
member.summary: Configures the request to allow a response with any without resulting in a throw.
member.remarks: By default, every reponse with an unsuccessful (non-2XX) will result in a throw.

member.param: The current request.
A representing the timeout value to be configured.
